column1: RedBrickMarket,"2010-11-30T16:27:12.81Z","Great item, good value, however, random bags can be disadvantages to a collection. This item is better for investment.","&nbsp
column5:
As has been seen in the LEGO minifigures series 1 and LEGO minifigures series 2, LEGO minifigures are a great value and almost always contain NEW parts!

Rating comments:
- The LEGO minifigures series 3 is unique in that all parts are NEW and none are completely the same as in other LEGO sets.
column6:
- As for purchasing for children's creativity, this set is little no no help at all. The sets are far to simple as just minifigures.
- From an investment standpoint, buying this one right when it comes out will be great for resale. However, as people are catching on to it's popularity, waiting until months after will NOT be a good investment.
- The great thing is that if you're building a town, these figures will be an amazing addition to your collection. Once again, however, there is a disadvantage. Because of the randomized packages, you may get minifigures for time periods not included in your collection can be frustrating.

NOTE:
People have investigated the code, and they can be decoded.
Also note that the minifigures are distributed exactly equal for each box of 60. If you're looking for all of them and don't want to take the time to decode, a full box is
column8:
to have at least two of each item.

OVERALL:
This item is great for it's price, and if you're looking to invest, there's almost no going wrong. However, if you want certain items, buy off eBay or BL at a higher price and get the exact one you want. This probably isn't the best ""present"", but as most people are saying, it will make a great stocking stuffer.
",TRUE,4,5,1,3,5

column1: ToughTom,"2010-12-01T16:24:52.497Z","Few amazing standouts, over all just good.","Theres a few in this set that I like a lot, mostly the Gorilla, baseball player, archer, and fisherman. The mummy worked out pretty good too due to the fact that I really like the Pharoh Quest sets. The only thing I really dislike about these I guess is compaired to the last set is the lack of extras. Everyone came with so many extra pieces and it was awesome. For example the karate master came with two gold trophies but the sumo only has the one. ",FALSE,4,4,2,5,3

column3: As usual, minifigures is very popular with some people. But have you ever opened a packet just to find that the minifig is not the one you wanted? or even worse, the one that you did not want? In this review, I have included some tips to prevent these scenarios&nbsp

column1: fisherman: Feel for the fish or the rope to the fishing pole.
pilot:Feel for the parachute and goggles. The goggles will have an indented
red indian chief: The headdress is very large and easy to feel
samurai:Feel for the sword or armor, which can be squished slightly by squeezing
snowboarder:The snowboard is easy to feel with both ends curving upward.
space villian:The only unique part to feel for is his robot hand.
sumo:The trophy is small and a little difficult to feel, but you can also try for the knob on his hairpiece.
elf: Feel for the longbow’s unique shape.
racecar driver:He’s the only figure with a helmet and hair, so feel for both.
gorrila suit guy:Feel for the banana, but be careful not to confuse it with the Pilot’s goggles.
hula dancer:Feel for the two maracas, but don’t confuse them with the Rapper’s mic.
rapper:Feel for the mic, but don’t confuse him with the Hula Girl who has two maracas

column6: Even though the barcodes have been removed from the packages, there are still ways to root out what’s inside. On at the bottom on the back of each package is a series of slightly raised dots. Each figure has its own unique set of dots. They can be difficult to see, but we have compiled a new cheat sheet to point you in the right direction. This, in combination with the decoding tips I gave for feeling the bags should help you find, or at least narrow down your search for the figures you are looking for.[img]http://http://www.itsalltrue.net/reviews/advimages/2010/lego/minifigschecklist3.jpg[/img]

column2: try these methods out if you want to, but they may spoil your surprise. happy guessing and feeling!!
